Posted By: Enchantment_Removal (7/14/2010 7:18:54 AM)

When I look at stuff like this, I wonder what Wizard's is doing. Why would you make a card that only is going to be effective in one-block? Did they think that all future blocks would also be Kamigawa? Was this even worth it in Kamigawa?

@DacenOctavio

Nope. MaRo recently had an article about how limited block hosers will always be part of magic. He was talking about the 'destroy target spirit or enchantemnt in Innistrad (I can't remember what its called) in particular, but he meant things like this too

posts.post_content: Why did WotC keep printing these cards that hosed a new, block-specific power? They did the same thing with Ice Age's snow-covered lands. Give the new mechanic a chance before you start stomping on it, guys.

Posted By: Jerec_Onyx (11/22/2012 10:06:51 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Actually not too bad now that [Geist of Saint Traft](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Geist of Saint Traft) is such a powerful card. Gets rid of the Geist before hexproof can protect him and if hes not there then lets you take away one of the other arcane spells blue/white are no doubt running. At the very least it let you see there hand. I would say black decks should actually conisder running this as hate against Gesit of Saint Traft if the meta is dictating it.
